article_title: Legislature inches toward end with Medicaid expansion not in sight
article_text: Walker promised during his campaign last year to expand Medicaid to about 40,000 other low-income Alaskans under the provisions of the Affordable Care Act, or Obamacare, with initial costs fully funded by the federal government. But his plans have so far been thwarted by top Republican legislators, who say the costs of the current $600 million-a-year program need to be reduced before it grows.

article_metadata.description: As the Legislature inched toward its scheduled end Sunday, it was looking increasingly unlikely that Gov. Bill Walker's plan to expand Medicaid would pass.

og.description: As the Legislature inched toward its scheduled end Sunday, it was looking increasingly unlikely that Gov. Bill Walker's plan to expand Medicaid would pass.

But his plans have so far been thwarted by top Republican legislators, who say the costs of the current $600 million-a-year program need to be reduced before it grows.
Walker promised during his campaign last year to expand Medicaid to about 40,000 other low-income Alaskans under the provisions of the Affordable Care Act, or Obamacare, with initial costs fully funded by the federal government.
